AbstractRay.backend.src.abstract_relu module

class AbstractRay.backend.src.abstract_relu.AbstractReLU(max_symbols: int | bool = False)

Bases: Module

Abstract ReLU layer for processing abstract domains.

This class provides a method to evaluate an abstract domain with ReLU activation, modifying the domain’s properties accordingly.

Parameters:

max_symbols (Union[int, bool], optional) – Maximum number of symbols. Defaults to False.

static evaluate(abstract_domain, device: device = device(type='cpu')) → Tuple[Tensor, Tensor, Tensor]

Evaluate the abstract domain with ReLU activation.

Parameters:

  • abstract_domain (dict) – The abstract domain containing the zonotope, center, sum, trash, and mask tensors.

  • device (torch.device, optional) – The device to perform the computation on. Defaults to torch.device(“cpu”).

Returns:

The updated abstract domain after ReLU activation.

Return type:

dict

AbstractRay.backend.src.evaluator module

class AbstractRay.backend.src.evaluator.ModelEvaluator(unstacked_model, abstract_domain, num_workers=0, available_RAM=8, device=device(type='cpu'), add_symbol=True, renew_abstract_domain=False, verbose=False, json_file_prefix='evaluation_results', noise_level=1e-05, model_cut=False)

Bases: object

A class to evaluate a model with unstacked layers using a given abstract domain.

Subtract one abstract domain from another.

AbstractRay
Args:

abstract_domain_1 (dict): The first abstract domain. abstract_domain_2 (dict): The second abstract domain to subtract.

Returns:

dict: The updated abstract domain after subtraction.

Raises:

AssertionError: If either abstract domain is not perfect.

AbstractRay.backend.src.process_abstract_maxpool2d_layer.process_max_pool2D(abstract_domain, maxpool_layer, num_workers, available_ram, device, add_symbol)

Process a MaxPool2D layer within the abstract domain.

Parameters:

  • abstract_domain (dict) – The abstract domain to process.

  • maxpool_layer (nn.MaxPool2d) – The MaxPool2D layer.

  • num_workers (int) – Number of workers for processing.

  • available_ram (int) – Available RAM in GB.

  • device (torch.device) – The device to run the processing on.

  • add_symbol (bool) – Flag to indicate whether to add a symbol.

Returns:

The updated abstract domain after processing the MaxPool2D layer.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

AssertionError – If the kernel size of the MaxPool2D layer is not 2.

AbstractRay.backend.src.process_layer module

AbstractRay.backend.src.process_layer.process_layer(abstract_domain, name, details, num_worker, available_ram, device, add_symbol)

Process a layer within the abstract domain.

Parameters:

  • abstract_domain (dict) – The abstract domain to process.

  • name (str) – The name of the layer.

  • details (dict) – The details of the layer, including the original, epsilon, and noise functions.

  • num_worker (int) – Number of workers for processing.

  • available_ram (int) – Available RAM in GB.

  • device (torch.device) – The device to run the processing on.

  • add_symbol (bool) – Flag to indicate whether to add a symbol.

Returns:

The updated abstract domain after processing the layer.

Return type:

dict

  • available_RAM (int) – Available RAM in GB.

  • device (torch.device) – The device to run the processing on.

AbstractRay.backend.src.sparse_evaluation module

class AbstractRay.backend.src.sparse_evaluation.SparseEvaluation(x: FloatTensor, chunk_size: int, mask_coef: FloatTensor | None = None, function: Callable | None = None, eval_start_index=0, device=device(type='cpu'), verbose=False)

Bases: object

A class to evaluate sparse tensors in chunks using parallel computation.

Parameters:

  • x (FloatTensor) – The sparse tensor to evaluate.

  • chunk_size (int) – The size of each chunk.

  • mask_coef (FloatTensor, optional) – The mask coefficient tensor. Defaults to None.

  • function (Callable, optional) – The function to apply to the dense tensor. Defaults to None.

  • eval_start_index (int, optional) – The starting index for evaluation. Defaults to 0.

  • device (torch.device, optional) – The device to run the evaluation on. Defaults to torch.device(‘cpu’).

  • verbose (bool, optional) – Flag to enable verbose output. Defaults to False.

evaluate_all_chunks(num_workers)

Evaluate all chunks using parallel computation.

Parameters:

num_workers (int) – Number of workers for parallel computation.

Returns:

The evaluated sparse tensor.

Return type:

torch.sparse.FloatTensor

evaluate_chunks_directly()

Evaluate chunks directly without parallel computation.

Returns:

The evaluated sparse tensor.

Return type:

torch.sparse.FloatTensor

AbstractRay.backend.src.unstack_network module

class AbstractRay.backend.src.unstack_network.UnStackNetwork(model, input_dim, threshold=1e-05, last_layer=None)

Bases: object

Unstack a PyTorch model and store information about each layer.

model

The PyTorch model to unstack.

Type:

nn.Module

input_dim

The dimensions of the input tensor.

Type:

tuple

output

Dictionary to store information about each layer.

Type:

dict

threshold

Threshold for comparing outputs.

Type:

float

last_layer

The deepht of layer choosen for analysis (e.g) if arg = 3, only the 3 first layers will be analysed

Type:

int,optional

Add an identity layer to the network.

Parameters:

x (torch.Tensor) – The input tensor.

Returns:

Return type:

torch.Tensor

compare_outputs(original_output, new_output, layer_name)

Compare the outputs of the original and modified layers.

Parameters:

  • original_output (torch.Tensor) – The output of the original layer.

  • new_output (torch.Tensor) – The output of the modified layer.

  • layer_name (str) – The name of the layer being compared.

Raises:

ValueError – If the difference between the original and new output exceeds the threshold.

AbstractRay.backend.src.util module

class AbstractRay.backend.src.util.SimpleCNN

Bases: Module

A simple convolutional neural network (CNN) model.

This model consists of two convolutional layers followed by max-pooling layers, and two fully connected layers.

conv1

First convolutional layer.

Type:

nn.Conv2d

relu1

ReLU activation for the first convolutional layer.

Type:

nn.ReLU

pool1

Max-pooling layer for the first convolutional layer.

Type:

nn.MaxPool2d

conv2

Second convolutional layer.

Type:

nn.Conv2d

relu2

ReLU activation for the second convolutional layer.

Type:

nn.ReLU

pool2

Max-pooling layer for the second convolutional layer.

Type:

nn.MaxPool2d

flatten

Flatten layer to reshape the tensor for the fully connected layers.

Type:

nn.Flatten

fc1

First fully connected layer.

Type:

nn.Linear

relu3

ReLU activation for the first fully connected layer.

Type:

nn.ReLU

fc2

Second fully connected layer.

Type:

nn.Linear

relu4

ReLU activation for the second fully connected layer.

Type:

nn.ReLU

forward(x)

Define the forward pass of the model.

Parameters:

x (torch.Tensor) – Input tensor.

Returns:

Output tensor after passing through the network.

Return type:

torch.Tensor

AbstractRay.backend.src.util.ensure_ray_initialized()

Ensure that Ray is initialized with the appropriate number of CPUs.

If Ray is not already initialized, this function initializes Ray with the number of CPUs available on the system.

Calculate statistics for a sparse tensor.

Parameters:

Returns:

A tuple containing the percentage of non-zero elements and the memory gain percentage.

tuple

Raises:

ValueError – If the tensor is not in COO format.

AbstractRay.backend.src.zono_sparse_gen module

class AbstractRay.backend.src.zono_sparse_gen.ZonoSparseGeneration

Bases: object

A class for generating sparse zonotopes from tensors and noise levels.

This class provides methods to create zonotopes based on input tensors, noise levels, and specific regions of interest.

global_storage

A dictionary to store global indices and values.

Type:

dict

zono_from_input_noise_level_and_mask(tensor_input, x_min, x_max, y_min, y_max, noise_level)

Generate a zonotope from an input tensor, noise level, and specified mask region.

Parameters:

  • tensor_input (torch.Tensor) – The input tensor.

  • x_min (int) – Minimum x-coordinate of the mask.

  • x_max (int) – Maximum x-coordinate of the mask.

  • y_min (int) – Minimum y-coordinate of the mask.

  • y_max (int) – Maximum y-coordinate of the mask.

  • noise_level (float) – The noise level to apply.

Returns:

The generated zonotope.

Return type:

torch.sparse.FloatTensor

zono_from_noise_level_and_tensor(noise_level, tensor)

Generate a zonotope from a noise level and tensor.

Parameters:

  • noise_level (float) – The noise level to apply.

  • tensor (torch.Tensor) – The input tensor.

Returns:

The generated zonotope.

Return type:

torch.sparse.FloatTensor

zono_from_tensor(noise_intensity, start_index=0)

Generate a zonotope from a tensor.

Parameters:

  • noise_intensity (torch.Tensor) – The tensor representing noise intensity.

  • start_index (int, optional) – The starting index for the zonotope. Defaults to 0.

Returns:

The generated zonotope.

Return type:

torch.sparse.FloatTensor
